definition: lit. newborn calves do not fear tigers (idiom)/fig. the young are fearless
pinyin: chu1 sheng1 niu2 du2 bu4 pa4 hu3

definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome
to be afraid/to fear/to dread/to be unable to endure/perhaps

sentences.english: The saying is that a bobby calf doesn't fear a tiger.
sentences.chinese: 正所謂，初生牛犢不怕虎嘛。

sentences.english: Still, Liu warns, it's 'a baby calf who is not afraid of a tiger.
sentences.chinese: 但劉善文警告說，這是初生牛犢不怕虎。

sentences.english: The newborn calf fears not the tiger.
